infodynamics.measures.continuous

TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo, TransferEntropyCommon

    public interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous

    Base interface for our information-theoretic calculators on continuous (double[]) data, providing common functionality for user-level measure classes.

    Usage of the child classes implementing this interface is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator;
    2. set properties via setProperty(String, String);
    3. Initialise the calculator using initialise() or other initialise methods defined by child classes;
    4. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using one or more calls to sets of "addObservations" methods defined by child classes, then
    5. Compute the required quantities, being one or more of:
      • the average measure: computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
      • or other quantities as defined by child classes.
    6. Return to step 3 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
      Compute the average value of the measure from the previously-supplied samples.

      Return the measure last calculated in a call to computeAverageLocalOfObservations() or related methods after the previous initialise() call.
      int getNumObservations()
      Get the number of samples to be used for the PDFs here which have been supplied by calls to "setObservations", "addObservations" etc.

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        void initialise()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialise the calculator for (re-)use, with the existing (or default) values of parameters. Clears any PDFs of previously supplied observations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
               java.lang.String propertyValue)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Set properties for the underlying calculator implementation. New property values are not guaranteed to take effect until the next call to an initialise method.

        Property names are defined by the implementing class (generally in their documentation). Unknown property values are ignored.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property
        propertyValue - value of the property
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for invalid property values

      • getProperty

        java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String propertyName)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Get current property values for the calculator.

        Valid property names, and what their values should represent, are the same as those for setProperty(String, String)

        Unknown property values are responded to with a null return value.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property
        Returns:
        current value of the property
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for invalid property values

      • getNumObservations

        int getNumObservations()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the number of samples to be used for the PDFs here which have been supplied by calls to "setObservations", "addObservations" etc.

        Note that the number of samples may not be equal to the length of time-series supplied (e.g. for transfer entropy, where we need to accumulate a number of samples for the past history of the destination).

        Returns:
        the number of samples to be used for the PDFs
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeAverageLocalOfObservations

        double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the average value of the measure from the previously-supplied samples.
        Returns:
        the estimate of the measure (in bits or nats, depending on the estimator)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getLastAverage

        double getLastAverage()
        Return the measure last calculated in a call to computeAverageLocalOfObservations() or related methods after the previous initialise() call.
        Returns:
        the last computed measure value

      • setDebug

        void setDebug(boolean debug)
        Set or clear debug mode for extra debug printing to stdout
        Parameters:
        debug - new setting for debug mode (on/off)
